snippet: Rice University researchers have developed a rapid malaria test that uses a laser pulse and may be able to detect the disease when only one red blood cell in a million is infected.
abstract: Study in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences reports that Rice University researchers have developed rapid malaria test that uses laser pulse, eliminating need to draw blood; test has yet to be tried on humans, but has shown high accuracy in mice.
lead_paragraph: Rice University researchers have developed a rapid malaria test that uses a laser pulse and may be able to detect the disease when only one red blood cell in a million is infected.

headline.main: A New Test for Malaria, No Blood Required
headline.print_headline: Diagnostics: A New Test for Malaria, No Blood Required

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
